creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: small accordion style book with delicate ink drawings of flowers, birds, and landscapes; light blue cover with faded silver design
text: The right-hand image in Chikuto_’s sketchbook, with stacked mountains rendered in Mi dots and a sedge coat-clad figure, is one of several early variations of the scene depicted in the previous hanging scroll. The quadrangular rocks in the sketch on the left are a characteristic identified with the paintings of the Yuan dynasty master Ni Zan (1301–1374), and a common feature in the work of artists following his style. The title of this work appears to be a later addition, as it is written on the book’s cover in a hand that does not appear to be the artist’s, who was by no means an ‘old man’ when he filled its pages. As well as painting, Chikuto_ wrote on music, poetry, and art. Inscription Fallen leaves, cold spring
title: Old Man Chikuto_’s Sketchbook
